Zdecydowanie NIE POLECAM. Od momentu zastąpienia pierwszej części tym czymś, trudno jest znaleźć jakiekolwiek pozytywne aspekty związane z tą grą. Jedynym plusem wydania tej gry na obecnej platformie jest możliwość spoglądania na realne statystyki aktywnych graczy, których pewnie z każdym dniem będzie coraz mniej ;)
More like Overwatch poo

Appreciate the Steam release and the native Steam integration - no Battle.net launcher is not needed to play. Even the Steam friends are natively integrated in the game and there are achievements (compared to e.g. Ubisoft's recent published games). While Blizzard is doing quite some crap recently (shop pricing, removed PvE modes, etc), it's unfortunately still fun with friends.

They released Overwatch 2 as a free to play business model, which leans more heavily into microtransactions, overpriced skins and predatory behaviour. To make matters worse, they shut down the first game, making it unplayable for people who purchased it, meaning the playerbase has to move over to this free to play business model to keep playing a game.

But at least it will have a promised PvE Hero mode that would feature character progression, which was a main part of the game’s selling point? no, that was cancelled. but you can buy a lighter story mission for "only" $15

Don't support this predatory behiavor.

Pros:  
-Best free 2 play game in terms of smoothness, premium feeling and overall polish.
-Amazing artstyle.
-Good variety of diverse characters that gives everyone a chance. Even a grandma on hear dying breath can take Junkrat or Mercy and contribute. 

Cons:
- A Blizzard game.
-Lost its soul over the past few years
- Some characters are poster characters of the game and can never be nerfed, like Tracer and Genji
- Battlepass and rewards are horrible
-PVE that was promised was scrapped for low effort missions.

All in all, game is still fun if you play it like 2 hours a week max. Dont take it too seriously, avoid competitive and you will be ait.
I give it a 6/10

This game kind of reminds me of the sequel to Overwatch:  Rule 34.

The skins in that game were really inspired and frequently unlocked for multiple characters at a time.  I think I even made it to top 500 since I was often able to find and finish a match in under 5 minutes.

Really hope this one brings the trilogy full circle with a satisfying conclusion for fans of all ages.

Fuck you Blizzard for ruining one of my beloved games, all for a cash grab. I’ve been a beloved Overwatch player ever since the second season came out, playing it day and night as a teen. Whenever someone/something mentions Overwatch, it deepens my anger and disappointment. I loved the game, it was one of my favorites along with Team Fortress 2, another multiplayer class-based fps game that I love the most. Its cinematics and in-game skins are what I loved the most, I was truly a fan of Overwatch. I put so many hours into this game until Blizzard ruined it. The announcement of Overwatch 2 was a little sketchy because Overwatch was still doing alright and didn’t need a remake. However, the team decided to because they announced that they couldn’t bring PVE mode to OW1 unless they create a new game. I had my hopes up, and I was a fool.

OW2 was basically the same aspect from the first, but way worse. It didn’t have much change since it looks very similar to OW1, just remodeling heroes and HUD, but other than that nothing has changed. The maps, gameplay, literally everything was the same for this so-called remake. Months before the release, I didn’t realize they were going to remove loot boxes and replace it for battle pass. At first, it was a pain to see it leave the game because it was a huge feature to the game, but I still went along with it. Once I opened the game, it was not what I was hoping for. With the drawback of overwatch being F2P, the transactions are insanely horrific to look at. And I thought that OWL skins were terrible in pricing, actual skins and sprays aren’t free anymore. And just to point it out, the damn battle pass is unnecessarily hard to grind for. I bought the Overwatch Origins edition about 6-7 years ago for $60, and it was well worth it. I’ll give it that but it’s a shame that I won’t get the full game I wanted. Is it unfair that I paid $60 for the full game but unlock battle pass tiers as the same rate as for those who literally downloaded it for free? It sucks to play this shit now that I bought the full game and you decided for us players to keep on paying.

I could talk a lot about Overwatch 2 being a huge letdown, many things like the horrible competitive progression ranking system, or the hero changes. The promise of PVE hero mode and loot boxes being deleted were the reasons why I finally uninstalled the game. I have never written a game review before, but this angers me a lot. A huge disgrace. Even though Team Fortress hasn’t had a major update ever since 2017, it’s amazing how the community is still active even with the bot evasion not so recently. TF2 solos >>>>>>> Overwatch, and the assumingly 2ish active employees at Valve are surprisingly better at not fucking a video game up than Blizzard. I’d rather have that than a shitfest of a remake.

If you didn’t read my first sentence, Fuck you Blizzard for ruining one of my beloved games.
